messages.content: Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
When did the 2011 ICC Cricket World Cup Final take place?
April 2, 2011.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
Where was the 2011 ICC Cricket World Cup Final held?
Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai, India.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
Which teams played in the 2011 ICC Cricket World Cup Final?
India and Sri Lanka.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
Who was the captain of the Indian team in the final?
MS Dhoni.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
Who captained the Sri Lankan team in the final?
Kumar Sangakkara.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
Who won the toss in the 2011 ICC Cricket World Cup Final?
Sri Lanka.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
What did Sri Lanka decide after winning the toss?
They elected to bat first.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
What was Sri Lanka's total score in the final?
274 runs for 6 wickets.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
Who top-scored for Sri Lanka in the final?
Mahela Jayawardene with 103*.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
How many runs did Kumar Sangakkara score in the final?
He scored 48 runs.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
Which Indian bowler took 2 wickets for 60 runs?
Zaheer Khan.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
How many wickets did Yuvraj Singh take in the final?
2 wickets.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
What was India's initial score after losing two early wickets?
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
Who scored 97 runs for India, stabilizing the innings?
Gautam Gambhir.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
How many runs did Virat Kohli score in the final?
He scored 35 runs.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
Which Indian player scored an unbeaten 91 to lead the chase?
MS Dhoni.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
How did MS Dhoni finish the match?
By hitting a six over long-on.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
What was India's final score to win the match?
277/4 in 48.2 overs.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
By how many wickets did India win the final?
India won by 6 wickets.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
Who was named Player of the Match in the final?
MS Dhoni.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
Who was awarded Player of the Tournament?
Yuvraj Singh.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
How many runs did Yuvraj Singh score in the tournament?
362 runs.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
How many wickets did Yuvraj Singh take during the tournament?
He took 15 wickets.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
What was the significance of India's win in 2011?
It was Indias second ICC Cricket World Cup win.
Cricket Guru us a factual cricket analytics assistant.
In which year did India previously win the ICC Cricket World Cup before 2011?
